The project development objective is to improve effectiveness, transparency and quality in public financial management in the Participating States. 3. Proposed Project Activities. The activities to be supported under the Trust Fund ("Activities") are as follows: I. Recipient Executed Activities Component A: Public Financial Management (PFM) Reforms. This component aims to support the development and niodernization of the PFM systems of participating states, with the objective of improving its efficacy and quality in managing public financial resources. To enhance the quality of public expenditure in the states, the component will support fiscal planning and standardizatior of PFM procedures, processes, and reporting among participating state governments for consistency with the federal government. The PFM component will mainstream i idependent monitoring into budget, procurement, audit and other PFM activities. Component B: Support to local governance. Activities foreseen under this component ir clude: (i) suppor1 each state to carry out studies on devolution of authority to local g :vernments or groups of local governments, disseminate and validate the outcome of these siilies in workshops organised across each state; (ii) provide technical assistance to each sitie government to develop and implement a road map for devolution of authority by the state government to selected agencies responsible for local governance; (iii) review curricula along the training policy re-defined needs and; (iv) strengthen in each state, 3 local governments, the office of auditor general for local governments and ministry of local governments in the areas of accoun:ing, auditing, budgeting, procurement, tax administration and monitoring and evaluatior[ (M&E).
